title: Boy charged with murder of schoolboy Baptista Adjei, 15
text:
Boy, 15, charged with murder after fatal stabbing of Baptista Adjei (Picture: Jack Dredd/Rex)

A 15-year-old boy has been charged with murder following the fatal daylight stabbing of another schoolboy – also 15 – in east London.

Baptista Adjei from North Woolwich was found critically injured on Stratford Broadway at around 3.20pm on Thursday.

The victim’s friends and members of the public provided first aid at the scene in an attempt to save the child’s life but he died as a result of his injuries around half-an-hour later.

Officers believe Baptista and a 15-year-old friend were attacked either on a bus, or shortly after getting off, near Stratford Shopping Centre.

On Saturday another 15-year-old boy handed himself into an east London police station and has subsequently been charged with murder, police said.

He was also charged with two counts of possessing an offensive weapon and grievous bodily harm with intent.

He is set to appear at Stratford Youth Court on Monday, October 14.

Stratford Shopping Centre was shut down following the attack (Picture: Jack Dredd/REX)

Aretha Adjei, Baptista’s aunt, has since paid tribute to her ‘fun loving nephew’.

Speaking to the Evening Standard, she said: ‘He was a nice boy, the fact that he died in his school uniform is horrific.

‘He had just finished school. He spoke to his mum on the phone about coming home after popping in to McDonald’s with a friend. Twenty minutes later he was stabbed to death.’

She added: ‘He was a fun-loving boy, very popular with everyone in church, everyone in the street knew him. He would come and put his arms around you. He would always make you laugh.’
